rqmlativ 0.0.9

Get an InjuryOccurrence

Source: R/Health.R
getInjuryOccurrence 2.Rd

This function returns a dataframe or json object of an InjuryOccurrence

getInjuryOccurrence(
  InjuryOccurrenceID,
  DistrictID = F,
  SchoolYearID = F,
  SchoolID = F,
  NameID = F,
  InjuryDateTime = F,
  IsVoid = F,
  VoidNote = F,
  UserIDVoidedBy = F,
  VoidedTime = F,
  LocationID = F,
  NameIDReportedBy = F,
  NameIDRespondedBy = F,
  HealthProfessionalID = F,
  ReportFileDate = F,
  IsImmediateCareRequired = F,
  DaysMissed = F,
  BodyParts = F,
  UserIDCreatedBy = F,
  CreatedTime = F,
  UserIDModifiedBy = F,
  ModifiedTime = F,
  fieldPaths = NULL,
  entityId = 1,
  schoolYearId = NULL,
  flatten = T,
  returnResponse = F
)

Arguments

InjuryOccurrenceID

The ID of the InjuryOccurrence to return.
fieldPaths

Fields from other objects with 'Many to One' or 'One to One' relationships to the given object listed as text. Run getSchemaForObjects('InjuryOccurrence') to get more field paths.
entityId

The id of the entity (school). Run listEntities for a list of entities. Defaults to 1 (district).
schoolYearId

The id of the schoolYear. Run listSchoolYears for a list of school years. Defaults to NULL (all school years).
flatten

Whether to flatten result into a dataframe or return the json object. Default is TRUE (flatten to dataframe).
returnResponse

Whether to return the server response instead of the results. Useful for debugging. Default is FALSE.
fieldNames

A TRUE or FALSE value determining whether or not to return the field for the given InjuryOccurrence. Defaults to FALSE for all return fields which, for convenience, returns all fields for the InjuryOccurrence.

Value

A dataframe or of InjuryOccurrence Skyward's Knowledge Hub

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
